NEELY:  We've heard rumours that you're going to unveil m the Leisure Center tonight.  Is this true?
FARLEY: Perfectly correct.
NEELY:  Could you tell us a little about it?
FARLEY: Let's just say that I'm putting Sanity back on th great Nation of ours.
NEELY:  And how does "local girl" Janet Majors fit into t things?
FARLEY: Very nicely --
{He catches Ralph's arm and moves away from Neely.}
FARLEY {aside to Ralph indicating Janet's picture} {conti billing's too big.
{Ralph smarts, then indicates to Macy, 'Take it down.'  P with pilot.
PILOT {ironically} Nice little town you've got here.
VANCE:  {grim} We like it.
{Fireworks explode.}
Sc. 76 Road to Center
{Ambulance traveling with Brad and Oliver.  Ricky drives.
OLIVER: Since you were separated at birth, he's followed move...and he's resented you all these years.
BRAD:   And Janet?
OLIVER: She represents everything he was denied.
{Fireworks explode}
Sc. 77 Leisure Center
{Farley, Ralph, Scotty, Mac and Nation are seated around in Farley's suite.  A picture of Farley hovers behind the smoke fills the air.  Macy stands at the door.  Farley wi stirring speech.}
FARLEY: ...and she represents everything that our custome Innocence, decency and the illusion of a happy ending.
MACY: {stepping though door} I'll go get her.

FARLEY: And behind her image the Dentonvale Chain of Take will thrive in the capable hands of two great ethical int operating on the frontiers of medical science {indicating Nation} ... coupled with the managerial genius of... {Sco "Ralph"} Ralph.  All under the firm guidance of a great s treacherous sea of diplomacy-- Everett Scott.
{Applause.  Meeting breaks up.  Ralph and Scotty inspect display' -- therapy cassettes, domestic restraint jackets entitled 'A Menu for Sanity', etc.  Farley crosses to Mac
FARLEY: I'd like to thank you for taking the neurosis out life.
{Door opens.  Macy escorts Janet in.  She stares at Farle
FARLEY: {continues} Janet!
JANET:  {amazed at resemblance} Brad!
Sc. 78 Exterior Leisure Center.
{Betty's VW pulls in front of building.  She is illuminat as she steps out of car.  A siren sounds behind her and s the ambulance pull into the entrance.  TV trucks surround and PA systems.}
RALPH and VO: And here she is!  Our very own!  America's World's Example!  Janet...The Sensation of the Planet!  { bring you...MISS MENTAL HEALTH.
{The crowd go wild...Oliver, Betty, Brad and Ricky run up entrance.  Guard on steps observes Brad's strait jacket.}
GUARD: {to other sentry}  That guy's sure to win the cost
Sc. 79 Leisure Center Interior

{We hear a fanfare and see Janet appear at the far end of steps onto a catwalk which is running the entire length o pool...Nation, Mac and Scotty are waiting on a festooned diving board...Nation has the microphone.}
NATION: {PA} Isn't she lovely?
MOM: {shouts} Mommy and Daddy love you, baby.
NATION: {PA} She walks in beauty...
MOM: {shouts} We love you, baby.
NATION: {PA} We all love Janet...Who do we love?
ALL: {shout} *JANET*!!

NATION: {PA} The dress Janet is wearing has been given by Creme Modes of Downtown Denton, and we've been asked that of the individual styling and exquisite tailoring...This the many gifts that have been so freely and generously gi the first of (we hope) many Miss Mental Healths...
{Brenda Drill preens at this remark.}
ALL: Hooray.
VOICE IN THE CROWD:  Let the President through.
{We pick up Oliver, Betty, Brad at the far end of the poo get through the crowd.  Ricky has found Ansalong.}
BETTY: {to Oliver} {astonished} The President's here...et
{The crowd parts and we see a rather nasty little man pop

PRESIDENT:  I'm Irwin Lappsy...President of Lappsy Auto.. my hand some keys...keys that I want to give to this litt being honoured here tonight...And I wanna tell you...that little Lady takes these same keys out to the parking lot this wonderful Leisure Complex...She'll find that they fi something...and what that something is...is a...*BRAND NE LUXE...*EIGHT CYLINDER CONVERTIBLE!!*  COMPLETE With  *RADIO*...*TAPEDECK*...*WASHABLE SEAT COVERS* and many ma extras...an' it's all hers for absolutely free.
{He hands *Mac* the keys.}
ALL:    Wow...Yeah...Hooray.
MOM:    You're beautiful, baby.
{Ralph steps back to the mike intercepting Mac who had th
RALPH:  Well, Janet's absolutely speechless, ladies and g that's alright.  Because we don't need her to talk...We j meet someone who needs no introduction.........
{Crowd cheer}
A...Mister...Farley...
CROWD: {scream} FLAVORS!
{Fanfare.  Farley enters grinning and waving.  Cheers as microphone.  Scotty pipes in organ underscoring--preacher

FARLEY: My friends.  Tonight, in declaring this temple of officially open, we are taking the first step of defiance something that will grow so big that the whole world will its sound.  And wherever our slogan 'SANITY AND VANITY' i will be linked incontrovertibly with this night...this to this...beautiful...face.
{Farley approaches Janet.}
BRAD: {shouts from crowd} SEDUCER!
{chord}
FARLEY: {amazed} And who are you, Sir!
{chord}
BRAD: {defiant} Your twin brother!  And your accuser!
{General consternation.  Janet looks from one to another. indeed identical.}
JANET:  Brad!  {Runs to him}
MAC: {to Parker}  Arrest that man!  He's committed to our
JANET: {to Mac} I never signed the papers.  He's not goin
{chord}
OLIVER: {to Farley} To revenge your twin--you tried to ab
FARLEY: This is all very sad and you're very confused, si
BRAD:   Then why did you choose her?
FARLEY: I don't.  I refuse her.  And you!...
SONG: "Duel-Duet"
{During this song the twins confront each other on the ca like a jousting tournament.}
FARLEY: You're a lose...an abomination   In the eyes of any sensitive man

BRAD:   An' you're a blind alley cruiser  Always heading down a losing straight  Dreamin' that you're screamin' at fate  You're a dead-end, dead-beat no-where mister  With a kiss like a Mississippi alligator's sister
FARLEY: I've took as much of you as any man can  You've lost your heart
BRAD:   You've lost your cause
FARLEY: You lost your baby when you lost your balls  You've lost your mind, you've lost your grip  So say bye bye
BRAD:   We lost our mom, we lost our dad  An' if I'm losing you, well that's just too bad
FARLEY: Well, the best thing you could ever do...is die
BRAD:   You're a failure...  A malformation in the guise of many, an also-ran

FARLEY: An' you're a weeper and a wailer  Always treading on the toes of the great  Generally spreading your weight  You're a spiteful, hateful asinine creature  A pupil with no scruples who knew better than the teacher
BRAD:   I've took as much of you as any man can
FARLEY: You've lost your heart
BRAD:   You've lost your cause
FARLEY: You lost your baby when you lost your balls  You've lost your mind, you've lost your grip  So say bye bye
BRAD:   We lost our home and our family  You've lost compassion, now you're losing me
FARLEY: The best thing you could ever do is die
BRAD:   The best thing you could ever do is die
BOTH:   The best thing you could ever do is die
{They finish up nose to nose screaming at each other...Fa who falls backwards into pool.  Janet rushes to him.}
FARLEY: Take no notice of him.  He's mad.
BRAD: {spluttering} I'm as sane as you are.  Saner!
{Mac grabs microphone.}
MAC: {PA} And he was only with us for a day.
{Crowd jeer and laugh.  Ralph takes mike.}
RALPH:  I hope Mr. Flavors will accept apologies on behal this unfortunate incident.  *Everyone* wants to be relate
{Crowd laugh--deriding Brad.  Janet comforts him.  Farley Furious.}
FARLEY: No offence!  On the contrary, this is a perfect e we're here to combat.  {He points at Brad, Janet, Oliver shouts--chanting} Out!  Out!  Out!
{The crowd pick up chant until 'Out, out, out' becomes a and this quartet retreat in fear of their lives.  the cro to cheers.}
FARLEY: {triumphant} See how we got rid of that little pr *United*!  And that's how we're gonna clean up the minds
{Cheers, whistles and take-away goods are being distribut nudges Ralph--Ralph indicates her to Farley.}

FARLEY: {continues} {PA} {to Brenda}  Would you care to j here, Miss, as we inaugurate the Farley Flavors Fabulous Sanatorium...first of a chain that will span from coast t from continent to continent...Step up, please, Miss...?
BRENDA: Brenda...Brenda Drill.
BRENDA'S MOTHER: Mommy loves you, Baby!
{Janet's mom looks suicidal...Dad consoles}
MOM:    What a nerve!  What a mouth!
DAD:    Shut up, Ruby, and listen to a success story.
NEELY PRITT: {in tears} I can't stand it.  Everything goo happens to other people.
NATION: {sotto voce} This could be worse than the old day
COSMO:  In the old days we didn't have a convertible.
{He rattles the keys.}
Sc. 80  Steps of Leisure Center
{Outside the Leisure Center we see Brad, Janet, Betty and shelter from the steps.}
FARLEY'S VOICE: {from TV monitors} And remember.  Sanity path to a more hygienic tomorrow.
{We hear the tiny voice of Neely Pritt coming from a TV m

NEELY: {VO}  And Fast Food Giant Farley Flavors has given Health what can only be described as an official kiss of the crowd are loving it...Not much is known of the girl w of the crowd here tonight and into the shoes......etc.
{The quartet are glum.  Janet's photograph is lowered in background.}
JANET:  Was I a victim of his heart  Or a victim of his schemes  Did he love me or resent you  Like a player in his dreams
{Crowd roars.  Images from 'inside' punctuate the followi
BRAD:   Why don't we all get out of here  There's nothing left to lose?
BETTY:  No.  We have the power to think and feel  We have the power to choose.
{Crowd roars.}
OLIVER: There's a cancer here among us  And it's gnawing at the heart  We can shake off the fetters  Of quacks and go-getters  And the way to begin -- is start!
{Music starts abruptly.  They sing and dance down the ste
SONG: "Anyhow! Anyhow!"

QUARTET: Some people do it for compassion  Some people do it for the fashion  Some people do it to be funny  Some people do it for the money  Some people do it for enslavement  Some people do it on the pavement  But
{They dance through the deserted streets.  We see the nig with twinkling stars.}

QUARTET: We're gonna do it anyhow! Anyhow!  We're gonna do it anyhow! Anyhow!  We're gonna do it -- no matter how the wind is blowing  We're gonna do it anyhow! Anyhow!  We're gonna do it anyhow! Anyhow!  We're gonna do it -- We just gotta keep going

Some people do it for each other {Brad and Janet smile}  Some people do it for their lovers {everyone smiles}  Some people do it for improvement {Oliver smiles}  Some people do it for the movement {Betty smiles}  Some people do it for enjoyment  Some people do it for employment
But
{People of Denton have moved--mass baptism style--into th wear strait jackets.  Farley presides.  Many seem to be d hold back.  Ricky, Ansalong, Glish and Oscar shake their retreat.}

Denton! Denton! You've got no pretention!  You're where the heart is! You're okay!  Denton! Denton! I'd just like to mention  You're the acceptable face of the human race  You're Denton! Denton! ...Denton, USA.
{The quartet are superimposed over the pool image marchin into the camera.  They look wonderful.}
QUARTET: We're gonna do it -- no matter how the wind is b We're gonna do it anyhow! Anyhow!   We're gonna do it -- We just gotta keep going.

{The quartet are joined by Ricky, Ansalong, Oscar and Gli band of outsiders.  Meanwhile the Leisure Center lights u lights like a giant fast food chainstore...All the window barred...Shadows of people move inside...Security guards sign reads:
FARLEY FLAVORS FABULOUS  *DENTONVALE SANATORIUM*
